title.narrative: By end 2021 the population in targeted zones, particularly women, schoolchildren and health facilities, and especially the most vulnerable, have the knowledge and motivation to use good hygiene and sanitation practices

description.narrative: Although the 2019 target for villages triggered was not reached, significant progress was made compared to 2018, with 574 villages total triggered in 2019 as a result of UNICEF direct support. 104,790 additional people (54,491 women) are living in 151 certified Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities, or 47 per cent of the 2019 target of 225,000 people. More villages have been declared open defecation free but are not yet certified due to administrative and operational constraints, and hence will be reported on in 2020. The certification bottleneck is being addressed with the Ministry of Environment, Water and Fisheries (MEEP). | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:08/02/2020
